Import from your Basecamp account

You can import all the people from your Basecamp account into Highrise. Everyone that's part of your company in Basecamp will be able to log into Highrise with the same username and password they currently use in Basecamp.

Enter your Basecamp address

http:// ..com

Enter the account owner's username and password

Username:

or Cancel

Product blog | Customer forum
Highrise is a service of 37signals.  Privacy policy | Terms of service

What is Basecamp?

Basecamp is a web-based project collaboration tool from 37signals, the same people that bring you Highrise.

Will Highrise and Basecamp always be
synced up for now on?

Highrise and Basecamp aren't actually synced up. If you add more people to Basecamp in the future you'll need to import them into Highrise again. But don't worry: Highrise will only import the new people — it won't re-import people you've already imported.

Upload a CSV file

Select the Comma Separated Values (CSV) file you want to import.

Note about Excel files: If you want to import contacts from an Excel spreadsheet, first you'll need to export the data into a CSV file.

You'll need to convert this Excel file to CSV format

We noticed you're trying to upload an Excel spreadsheet. We can import the contacts you've stored in Excel, but first you'll need to export them in CSV format. Don't worry, it'll take less than a minute to do.

How do I do it?

Here's a simple tutorial that shows you how to export your contacts from an Excel spreadsheet into a CSV file. Once you've done that, just upload the new CSV file to Highrise and you'll be all set.

What does CSV mean anyway?

CSV stands for Comma Separated Values. It means that each bit of contact data is separated by a comma. This makes it possible to parse the data and put it in the right place ("John" in the "First Name" field instead of the "Company" field, for example.)
